channel.title: The New York Times Trends
channel.description: 用中文浏览纽约时报热门报道

item.title: Mayor Eric Adams offered New York City as a safe haven to Americans seeking abortions after the Supreme Court overturned Roe v. Wade. https://t.co/7yhcO3wczS https://t.co/GDlBUUZtxl

The Jan 6. committee’s public hearings, with their clear, uninterrupted narratives about Donald Trump’s effort to undercut the peaceful transfer of power, have left some pro-Trump Republicans regretting a decision to boycott the panel. https://t.co/H0mPWZ1WRA

The Supreme Court ruling to overturn Roe v. Wade will be one of the signal legacies of President Donald Trump, who vowed to name justices who would overrule Roe. All three of his appointees were in the majority in the 6-to-3 ruling. https://t.co/QMcMKpWFxC

We took a look at the current state of abortion in the U.S. Most abortions occur in the first trimester. Though some women have more than one abortion in their lifetime, the typical abortion patient has never had one before. https://t.co/usvFnC8Cpm https://t.co/AVIBYxJctZ

Breaking News: The Supreme Court overruled Roe v. Wade, eliminating the constitutional right to abortion in a decision that will lead to all but total bans on the procedure in about half of the U.S. Chief Justice John Roberts voted with the majority. https://t.co/KiIUF7WKC1 https://t.co/XfZ2HqIFZ2

Breaking News: The Supreme Court overturned Roe v. Wade, eliminating the constitutional right to abortion after almost 50 years in a decision that will transform American life. https://t.co/bqkMP7tfby

The 215-pound snake was the largest Burmese python ever found in Florida, breaking a record set by the invasive species in 2016 at 140 pounds, according to the Conservancy of Southwest Florida. https://t.co/CJmvohpo5K https://t.co/oaEuCM4czY

We pieced together the narrative of Donald Trump’s monthslong campaign to subvert American democracy and cling to power. Revisit the full timeline as the House Jan. 6 committee continues its fifth day of hearings. https://t.co/aMF33bw51Z

Dr. Deborah Birx, Donald Trump’s Covid coordinator, told congressional investigators that Trump White House officials asked her to change or delete parts of guidance to states, in what she called an effort to stifle information as cases surged in 2020. https://t.co/SUMZIDWPfC
Breaking News: The Senate has passed a bipartisan gun safety bill, breaking nearly three decades of inaction on substantial gun legislation. https://t.co/lwMUf8tSwR

The Biden administration is throwing out the narrowed definition of "habitat" for endangered animals, returning to an understanding that existed before the Trump administration shrank the areas that could be protected for animals threatened by extinction. https://t.co/EksQk9xut6

The Senate passed a bipartisan gun safety bill 65 to 33, with 15 Republicans supporting the measure, breaking nearly three decades of inaction on substantial gun legislation. https://t.co/DHPzpbWexe https://t.co/RsndCtan4W

Gov. Kathy Hochul of New York said her team was preparing legislation to counteract a Supreme Court ruling that struck down the state’s law restricting the carrying of handguns. Mayor Eric Adams of New York City pledged to work to limit the ruling’s impact.https://t.co/fQBO2kZP1n https://t.co/1tHgXYRSU8

The European Union officially made Ukraine a candidate for membership on Thursday. The decision sends a powerful message of solidarity to Kyiv and a rebuke to Vladimir Putin, who has worked for years to keep Ukraine from building Western ties. https://t.co/U8Jy1iH1Cy

Everleigh McCarthy was less than 2 weeks old when she died at a Boston hospital. Then her parents were told the hospital lost her body. Police said it "was probably mistaken as soiled linen" and discarded. "It's like she died all over again," her mom said. https://t.co/jvL287eT7B

Breaking News: Federal investigators searched the home of Jeffrey Clark, a former Justice Department official in the Trump administration, as part of the inquiry into efforts to overturn the 2020 election. https://t.co/dFEsF20H0Y

Representative Mo Brooks, stinging from his resounding defeat in Alabama’s Republican runoff for the Senate on Tuesday and a snub from Donald Trump, now appears to be willing to testify as part of the Jan. 6 investigation under certain conditions. https://t.co/VZZHonYGoD

Trumpet, a magnificently be-wrinkled and be-jowled bloodhound from Illinois, won Best in Show at the Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show on Wednesday night. He is the first bloodhound to win. https://t.co/JDvl4Qhtbr https://t.co/grk7mpg7My

Representative Liz Cheney, a Republican of Wyoming, is urging Democrats in her home state to switch parties to support her in the Aug. 16 primary as her polling remains far behind her Trump-endorsed challenger. https://t.co/kIUE3ojcLZ

The Supreme Court’s decision to strike down New York State’s concealed carry gun law was “appalling,” and “just not rooted in reality,” Mayor Eric Adams said Thursday. “This decision has made every single one of us less safe from gun violence,” he said. https://t.co/l4f3JNdHnQ
Federal prosecutors asked a judge to sentence Ghislaine Maxwell to at least 30 years in prison for helping Jeffrey Epstein abuse girls. https://t.co/ruHbt1FDJO

The Supreme Court's reluctance to hear Second Amendment cases changed as its membership shifted to the right in recent years. The court's conservative bloc voted on Thursday to overturn a century-old New York law restricting the carrying of handguns. https://t.co/FjVGDHuB0h https://t.co/i5nXE34kmu
With THC levels close to 100%, today’s cannabis products are poisoning some heavy users, including teenagers, experts say. https://t.co/QJKSLTSGzb

The band Muna is on the verge of breaking out of its cult following and bringing its anthems about queer joy to a wider audience. Their new label, Saddest Factory Records, is run by Phoebe Bridgers. https://t.co/cJTnauzywp

New York officials and law enforcement are preparing for a new legal regime after the Supreme Court struck down a law limiting handgun carrying. Gov. Kathy Hochul called the ruling "absolutely shocking" and said she already had language for new measures. https://t.co/0aD5FWlAtT
Breaking News: The FDA ordered Juul to stop selling e-cigarettes in the U.S., a big setback to the brand blamed for the teen vaping crisis. https://t.co/YkyMalicqG
Breaking News: The U.S. will cancel $6 billion in student loans for 200,000 people who attended for-profit colleges and other schools accused of fraud. https://t.co/6lGrPSJvbe
Breaking News: The Supreme Court overturned a New York law limiting guns in public, a ruling with major implications on laws restricting guns outside the home. https://t.co/BeXW6AcpOP
Breaking News: The Biden administration has proposed new rules that would bar discrimination against transgender students under Title IX and cement their rights into law. https://t.co/AljktNpGuc

As the American artistic swimmer Anita Alvarez fainted and sank toward the bottom of the pool at the world championships, her coach Andrea Fuentes made a split-second decision: She dove in to save her.
Alvarez is doing "fine" now, her coach said. https://t.co/ptsESwZoIw

The House committee investigating the Jan. 6 attack plans to unveil new evidence about how Donald Trump tried to manipulate the Justice Department to help him cling to power after he lost the 2020 election, aides said. https://t.co/XXlYkiHB3p

Thousands of refugees from Ukraine have been sent to so-called filtration camps, where they have been interrogated and then forced to resettle in Russia. Some Ukrainians escaped to Estonia. They told us their stories. https://t.co/hdSAOJUOdw https://t.co/DROTq6Ajr5

Trumpet the bloodhound: Best in Show. 🎺
He competed in his first dog show in January — and on Wednesday he became the first of his breed to win the Westminster Dog Show. https://t.co/PUwLEWA8pz https://t.co/uyvp62HXQn

As fuel prices soar in the U.S., President Biden called on Congress to temporarily lift the federal gas tax — about 18 cents per gallon of gasoline and 24 cents per gallon of diesel — through the end of September. https://t.co/KZhZYt3Vav https://t.co/ZWwWV6tNPD

As the American artistic swimmer Anita Alvarez fainted and sank toward the bottom of the pool at the world championships, her coach Andrea Fuentes made a split-second decision: She dove in to save her.
Alvarez is doing "fine" now, her coach said. https://t.co/w5b9w4t1Iz https://t.co/msOBUa3PY7

A poor harvest of chiles has caused an “unprecedented shortage” of Asian hot sauces, said a California-based firm that produces one of the world's most popular sriracha sauces.
“I only have like three bottles. What am I going to do?” said one sriracha fan.https://t.co/Mhhmc17N48

The chief of the school district police force in Uvalde, Texas, was placed on administrative leave after the state’s top police official faulted him for delaying the confrontation with a gunman at Robb Elementary School last month, the school district said.https://t.co/QMnBNaSocb

🎺 Trumpet the bloodhound has made history. 🎺
He competed in his first dog show in January — and now he's the first of his breed to become the Westminster Dog Show champion. https://t.co/wzF9xetUYz https://t.co/Pg40cQW7X4

"It was such a hard right-wing, racist society that I grew up in. I have a lot of friends and even kinfolk who never tried to move beyond the racism. But I try every day. It’s been an ongoing, gradual transformation," the writer John Grisham tells @NYTmag. https://t.co/qMJK6iMZCr
Breaking News: Federal prosecutors asked a judge to sentence Ghislaine Maxwell to at least 30 years in prison for helping Jeffrey Epstein abuse girls. https://t.co/RpvwrlGH9w

Britain declared a national incident after finding evidence suggesting local spread of poliovirus in London. No cases of polio have been identified so far, but officials urged those who were not fully immunized to seek vaccines immediately. https://t.co/BwaLh50ja4

Breaking News: Trumpet, a bloodhound, won Best in Show at the Westminster Dog Show.
Get a recap of the action and see photos of all the very good dogs from the competition. https://t.co/X018uoZxzD https://t.co/STXHSFmTyp
Dozens of groups called on President Biden to strike a deal for the release of Brittney Griner, the WNBA star who has been detained in Russia since February. https://t.co/jxo2JiMVCL
Breaking News: The Justice Department subpoenaed at least three more people linked to an effort to use fake electors to keep Donald Trump in power. https://t.co/sdbrv6o3bS

Budae jjigae, or army base stew, is a symbol of resourcefulness and survival during a time of great poverty. It is one of @ericjoonho's 10 essential Korean dishes. https://t.co/mflhuEa2ms https://t.co/T3bBtDwHvb

Rupert Murdoch and Jerry Hall are said to be getting divorced. Murdoch’s fourth divorce is unlikely to change the ownership structure of his empire, but it could reverberate through companies such as Fox News and The Wall Street Journal. https://t.co/cz2tXZseU2

The head of Texas' state police called the police response to the Uvalde shooting "an abject failure" that ran counter to decades of training. He said officers wasted time looking for a classroom door key that was "never needed." https://t.co/InsjmTIDE6

“It’s direct, indisputable, empirical evidence that this kind of common claim that ‘the only thing that stops a bad guy with the gun is a good guy with the gun’ is wrong,” said an Alabama professor who has studied mass shootings for more than a decade. https://t.co/V4w8UEyqHn
Clela Rorex, a county clerk who in 1975 issued the first marriage license to a gay couple in Colorado, has died. She was 78. https://t.co/nrjgGvjbon

The recent arrest of Paul Pelosi, Speaker Nancy Pelosi’s husband, in Napa Valley has shone a light on their lavish California life. It has also refocused attention on his troubled driving record, including a crash when he was 16 that left his brother dead. https://t.co/lOwqnUjvcd
